column2: BLOCKHEAD-HANS
column3: BLOCKHEAD HANS

column2: All the servants stood in the courtyard and saw them mount their steeds, and here by chance came the third brother; for the squire had three sons, but nobody counted him with his brothers, for he was not so learned as they were, and he was generally called 'Blockhead-Hans.'
column3: All the servants stood in the courtyard and saw them mount their steeds, and here by chance came the third brother; for the squire had three sons, but nobody counted him with his brothers, for he was not so learned as they were, and he was generally called 'Blockhead Hans.'

column2: You are in your Sunday-best clothes!'
column3: You are in your Sunday best clothes!'

column2: 'We are going to Court, to woo the Princess!
column3: 'We are going to Court, to woo the Princess!

column2: 'Hurrah!
column3: 'Hurrah!

column2: I'll go to!' cried Blockhead-Hans; and the brothers laughed at him and rode off.
column3: I'll go to!' cried Blockhead Hans; and the brothers laughed at him and rode off.

column2: 'Dear father!' cried Blockhead-Hans, 'I must have a horse too.
column3: 'Dear father!' cried Blockhead Hans, 'I must have a horse too.

column2: What a desire for marriage has seized me!
column3: What a desire for marriage has seized me!

column2: 'Stop that nonsense!' said the old man.
column3: 'Stop that nonsense!' said the old man.

column2: 'I will not give you a horse. YOU can't speak; YOU don't know how to choose your words.
column3: 'I will not give you a horse. YOU can't speak; YOU don't know how to choose your words.

column2: Your brothers! Ah! they are very different lads!'
column3: Your brothers! Ah! they are very different lads!'

column2: 'Well,' said Blockhead-Hans, 'if I can't have a horse, I will take the goat which is mine; he can carry me!'
column3: 'Well,' said Blockhead Hans, 'if I can't have a horse, I will take the goat which is mine; he can carry me!'

column2: And he did so.
column3: And he did so.

column2: 'Hullo!' bawled Blockhead-Hans, 'here I am!
column3: 'Hullo!' bawled Blockhead Hans, 'here I am!

column2: Just look what I found on the road!'--and he showed them a dead crow which he had picked up.
column3: Just look what I found on the road!'--and he showed them a dead crow which he had picked up.

column2: 'Blockhead!' said his brothers, 'what are you going to do with it?'
column3: 'Blockhead!' said his brothers, 'what are you going to do with it?'

column2: 'With the crow?
column3: 'With the crow?

column2: I shall give it to the Princess!'
column3: I shall give it to the Princess!'

column2: 'Do so, certainly!' they said, laughing loudly and riding on.
column3: 'Do so, certainly!' they said, laughing loudly and riding on.

column2: 'Slap! bang! here I am again!
column3: 'Slap! bang! here I am again!

column2: Look what I have just found!
column3: Look what I have just found!

column2: Are you going to send that, too, to the Princess?'
column3: Are you going to send that, too, to the Princess?'

column2: 'Slap! bang! here I am!' cried Blockhead-Hans; 'better and better--it is really famous!'
column3: 'Slap! bang! here I am!' cried Blockhead Hans; 'better and better-it is really famous!'

column2: 'Oh,' said Blockhead-Hans, 'it is really too good!
column3: 'Oh,' said Blockhead Hans, 'it is really too good!

column2: How pleased the Princess will be!'
column3: How pleased the Princess will be!'

column2: 'Why!' said the brothers, 'this is pure mud, straight from the ditch.'
column3: 'Why!' said the brothers, 'this is pure mud, straight from the ditch.'

column2: 'Of course it is!' said Blockhead-Hans, 'and it is the best kind!
column3: 'Of course it is!' said Blockhead Hans, 'and it is the best kind!

column2: Look how it runs through one's fingers!' and, so saying, he filled his pocket with the mud.
column3: Look how it runs through one's fingers!' and, so saying, he filled his pocket with the mud.

column2: This was a very good thing, for otherwise they would have torn each other in pieces, merely because the one was in front of the other.
column3: This was a very good thing, for otherwise they would have torn each other in pieces, merely because the one was in front of the other.

column2: 'It doesn't matter!' said the Princess. 'Away! out with him!'
column3: 'It doesn't matter!' said the Princess. 'Away! out with him!'

column2: 'It is hot in here, isn't it!' said the suitor.
column3: 'It is hot in here, isn't it!' said the suitor.

column2: My father is roasting young chickens to-day!' said the Princess.
column3: My father is roasting young chickens to day!' said the Princess.

column2: He was not prepared for such a speech; he did not know what to say, although he wanted to say something witty.
column3: He was not prepared for such a speech; he did not know what to say, although he wanted to say something witty.

column2: 'Of course!
column3: 'Of course!

column2: 'How do you--um!' he said, and the reporters wrote down.
column3: 'How do you-um!' he said, and the reporters wrote down.

column2: 'How do you--um.'
column3: 'How do you-um.'

column2: 'It doesn't matter!' said the Princess. 'Take him out!'
column3: 'It doesn't matter!' said the Princess. 'Take him out!'

column2: 'Of course!
column3: 'Of course!

column2: 'That's good!' replied Blockhead-Hans; 'then can I roast a crow with them?'
column3: 'That's good!' replied Blockhead Hans; 'then can I roast a crow with them?'

column2: 'With the greatest of pleasure!' said the Princess; 'but have you anything you can roast them in? for I have neither pot nor saucepan.'
column3: 'With the greatest of pleasure!' said the Princess; 'but have you anything you can roast them in? for I have neither pot nor saucepan.'

column2: 'I have so much that I can quite well throw some away!' and he poured some mud out of his pocket.
column3: 'I have so much that I can quite well throw some away!' and he poured some mud out of his pocket.

column2: 'I like you!' said the Princess.
column3: 'I like you!' said the Princess.

column2: And the reporters giggled, and each dropped a blot of ink on the floor.
column3: And the reporters giggled, and each dropped a blot of ink on the floor.

column2: 'That was neatly done!' said the Princess. 'I couldn't have done it; but I will soon learn how to!'
column3: 'That was neatly done!' said the Princess. 'I couldn't have done it; but I will soon learn how to!'

column2: Blockhead-Hans became King, got a wife and a crown, and sat on the throne; and this we have still damp from the newspaper of the editor and the reporters--and they are not to be believed for a moment.
column3: Blockhead Hans became King, got a wife and a crown, and sat on the throne; and this we have still damp from the newspaper of the editor and the reporters-and they are not to be believed for a moment.
